intro: Cavanillea philippensis, commonly known as the Philippine cavanillea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
